oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter written by William Henry Bendy, Co. M, 9th N.J., Inf. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Henry Bendy wrote this letter from Carolina City, North Carolina to his family. The regiment was on occupation duty on the North Carolina coast after serving around Petersburg, Virginia. The author joined the regiment just before they departed. He describes the death of several of his comrades and states that "they did not dare to show their heads above the Brest Works (sic) if they did it was shure deth (sic)" Bendy also mentions the sea food available now that they are on the coast.
